item.description:
We're going to see world-famous opera star Denyce Graves give a performance as part of New Haven's International Festival of Arts & Ideas.

I don't know what she'll be performing at the show, but her full repertoire includes many operatic roles, as well as sacred and 20th century classical music, German lieder, French melodie, English art song, Broadway standards, and Latin jazz songs in Spanish and Portuguese.

To learn more about the show, and hear some clips of her, visit the event page here.

I'd recommend buying tickets in advance, since some shows do sell-out. Though if you wait for the day-of, you might score a half-off "Rush" ticket (if you get one at all).

PRE-PARTY: I don't know yet if we'll be up for dinner before. If you're interested, let me know, and I'll get back to you about it.

HOST: Jason, cell #203-901-4957 (calling or texting is fine)

TICKETS: Info on buying is here. You can buy at the door, at the Box Office, by phone, or online. Here's a link to the actual event. Tickets range from $7-45; most of them are $33. We already have our tickets since we didn't want to miss-out and wanted good seats. If you want to try to get tickets near us, we're in mezzanine row B, seats 1 & 2 (not cheap seats).

PARKING: If you're going to a paid Arts & Ideas event you're supposed to get a voucher for discounted parking along with your ticket. A list of garages accepting these vouchers is here.

Directions to the Shubert are here.

If you want to arrange car-pools, chat about the event, etc, click here to visit the thread on the message board
item.name: Fri. 6/27 - Opera star in New Haven
